Paladini.question: Aiming for timescales between 0.15 to 40d; recommend 3.5d observing windows of 8 visits each, intervals 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14 and 16hrs

Paladini2.comment: Time domain study of small region in W40/Serpens South
Paladini2.question: Aiming for timescales between 0.15 to 40d; recommend 3.5d observing windows of 8 visits each, intervals 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14 and 16hrs

Benecchi.comment: Solar System (Kuiper Belt), RA=289.4, DEC=-20.2, 3xWFI FOV

Kupfer.region: Selected fields of high stellar density

Elowitz.questions: choice of filters, preference of area

Lodieu.questions: Effectively an all-sky survey, all filters, so no practical constraints

Lodieu2.comment: Selected Globular Clusters spanning a range of metallicities

Hunt.comment: Contiguous area survey for Star clusters; filter choice determined for CMD

Werner.comment: Star Forming Regions; inc Orion SFR, Rho Ophiuchi SFR, Taurus SFR

Bryant.comment: Stellar associations in the Galactic Plane

Lian.comment: Stellar-mass Black Holes in Carina nebula

Anderson.comment: Ionized Hydrogen in ISM.  F184 filter there could be other bright lines, so it may be difficult to isolate emission from Pa-alpha without G150 for at least a selected sub-region

Lim1.questions: Author suggests alternative regions if this is too large

DAmmando.questions: 2-3 sequences per day, every 3-4d, upto 40 visits

Villasenor.comment: Young massive stars in HII regions
Villasenor.questions: Goal is ~20 clusters, as for regions and preference

Minniti.comment: Free-floating planets in stellar associations; Lower Centaurus Crux (LCC)
Minniti.questions: Preferred cluster region(s), or all 200deg in Centaurus?

Smith.questions: Confirmed survey region and filter choices

Navarro.questions: Follow stellar density, especially in given region, preferred filters Ks~F213, Z~F106, Y~F106, J~F129, and H~F158

De_Furio.comment: Star forming regions; Taurus; Sco-Cen; Orion Nebula Cluster; Orion molecular Cloud (TEMPO region), Chamaeleon I

Baravalle.regions: Northern and Southern Galactic Disk, Galactic Bulge, Norma and Ophiuchus regions

Meli.comment: Galactic magnetic fields and cosmic rays
regions: Galactic Plane, Sgr A*, Starburst galaxies, SNRs, Massive star clusters,

Morihana2.comment: Cataclysmic Variables in the Galactic Plane.  Minimum of 1 filter, ideally 2 in priority order.  Any region within footprint valuable

Lucas.questions: confirmed whole galactic plane region and filters
Lucas.comment: Clusters and YSOs; Three filters: either (F129, F158, F213) or (F129, F184, F213).  F213 only for second epoch

targets.region: Perseus Molecular Cloud (including NGC 1333 and IC 348)
Vela Molecular Ridge (including Vela Molecular Clouds)

Daylan.questions: Confirm filter choice; also need time cadence;

Bahramian.questions: preferred region; Also need minimum cadence

Carey1.comment: Survey regions of existing IR surveys WISE, Spitzer and Herschel
Carey1.questions: define survey regions and filters; refined to GRIPS footprint in all filters

Carey2.questions: Confirmed filters and preferred survey fields

Rich2.comment: Stellar populations; time domain survey of nuclear region
Rich2.questions: Cadence: 15min recommended but over what interval? Nominally 8hrs

Minniti2.comment: Globular cluster pairs: UKS1 + VVVCL01 and NGC6522 + NGC6528 (Baade's Window)

VVV_keyholes_1st_priority.comment: First priority keyholes through the Milky Way from VVV/VVVx.  Included in the second set to ensure weighting

VVV_keyholes_2nd_priority.comment: Second priority keyholes through the Milky Way from VVV/VVVx.  Includes the first set as well to ensure weighting

Lim3_grism_targets.comment: W51, M17 and/or M16, in priority order, from Wanggi Lim

Sankrit.comment: Wide area survey for windows of low extinction.  Needs 4 filters: F067 essential, F184, F213 recommended, plus any one other

Gallart.comment: Wide area survey to trace stellar ages for star formation histories

Ivanov1.questions: Need specific target or field pointings

Ivanov2.questions: Need specific target or field pointings

Craig1.questions: What region of the Plane to survey and cadence

Craig2.questions: Target catalog of novae from last 100yrs

Saydjari.comment: Survey of Diffuse Interstellar Bands and ISM.  At least four ideally five filters needed.  Image tiling should include offsets/roll angles for calibration
Saydjari.questions: Requested survey regions based on APOGEE DIBs catalog

Hillenbrand.comment: Spectroscopic observations of non-crowded star fields for stellar characterization and extinction

Gramze.comment: Survey for star formation in the central Galactic Bar regions.

Sabin.comment: Survey for evolved intermediate-mass stars, AGB, planetary nebulae, novae, cataclysmic variables and symbiotic stars. Project can work with l=+/-41deg if reduced area

Bonito.questions: Specific region definitions for the targets

Minniti_GCs.comment: Multi-epoch, multi-wavelength imaging of Globular Clusters in the central Bulge

Pal.comment: Stellar spectral template library; regions in order of priority; data on one region valuable

Saito.comment: Range of science from extended Bulge region, including Solar System, stellar populations, galactic structure
